Class Editor

java.lang.Object
main.java.text_editor.editors.Editor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Editable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SpellCheckEditor, TranslateEditor
public abstract class Editor extends Object implements Editable, Cloneable, Serializable
The abstract Editor class serves as the base class for all editor implementations. It provides common text editing functionality like adding and removing text, managing caret position, and basic text manipulation.

This class implements Editable, Cloneable, and Serializable interfaces, providing a foundation for more specialized editors.

Author:
Ugnius Tei≈°erskis

  • Constructor Details

    • Editor

      public Editor()
      Default constructor that initializes an empty editor with caret at position 0.

    • Editor

      public Editor(String initialText)
      Constructor that initializes the editor with the specified text and places the caret at the end of the text.
      Parameters:
      initialText - the initial text to populate the editor with

  • Method Details

    • addText

      public void addText(char character)
      Adds a single character at the current caret position and advances the caret.
      Specified by:
      addText in interface Editable
      Parameters:
      character - the character to add

    • addText

      public void addText(String text)
      Adds a string at the current caret position and advances the caret to the end of the inserted text.
      Parameters:
      text - the string to add

    • removeLastCharacter

      public final void removeLastCharacter()
      Removes the character immediately before the caret position and moves the caret backward by one position. If the text is empty, this method has no effect.
      Specified by:
      removeLastCharacter in interface Editable

    • removeWord

      public void removeWord()
      Removes the word at the current caret position. The method identifies a word by looking for characters that are not whitespace. If no word is found or the text is empty, this method has no effect.

    • removeWord

      public void removeWord(String word)
      Removes all occurrences of the specified word from the text. Only complete words matching the specified word are removed. A word is considered complete if it is surrounded by whitespace or text boundaries.
      Parameters:
      word - the word to remove from the text

    • setCaretPosition

      public void setCaretPosition(int position)
      Sets the caret position in the text. If the specified position is out of bounds, the position is adjusted to the closest valid position.
      Parameters:
      position - the new caret position

    • getCaretPosition

      public int getCaretPosition()
      Gets the current caret position in the text.
      Returns:
      the current caret position

    • getTextLength

      public int getTextLength()
      Gets the length of the text in the editor.
      Returns:
      the length of the text

    • transform

      public abstract void transform()
      Abstract method that transforms the text content according to the specific editor implementation. Subclasses must implement this method to define their transformation behavior.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the editor content.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the text content as a string
